overview_info.Areas of Concentration: Christian Archaeology and Byzantine Art History, Classical Archaeology, Prehistory and Early History

Target group: The consecutive Master's course is a scientific course of study leading to an additional professionally qualifying degree based on the first professionally qualifying degree. Its goal is to provide in-depth scientific knowledge in the areas Pre-Historical and Early Archaeology, Classical Archaeology and Christian Archaeology and Byzantine Art History.
Annotation of the Higher Education Insti: If the Bachelor degree certificate is not available by the application deadline, but at least 135 credit points can be demonstrated: Submit a certificate of study and examinations and the average grade achieved so far. (This certificate must be issued by the relevant higher education, original or officially authenticated copy). If the degree was obtained abroad: officially authenticated copy of a certificate of recognition (responsible: Student Service - Admission International).After enrolment, the diploma must be submitted.

overview_info.Subject:
Das Archaeology gehört zum Studienbereiche History, Ancient Studies der Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.Weitere Informationen zur Fächergruppe Language and Cultural Studies.
                                                Archaeology

Target group: The prehistory, early history and archaeology of the Middle Ages deal with the legacies of man from past times. These are developed using archaeological methods in order to scientifically evaluate and interpret them. The time frame here extends from the beginnings of mankind through the Stone and Metal Ages to the Middle Ages and modern times. The geographical range includes primarily the Old World. Depending on the research direction, it ranges from Central Europe to the Mediterranean region and Africa to Asia.

tuition_fees_info.Annotation to the tuition fee: NEW: EUR 234 a month in connection with grant by CHANCEN eG. Together with CHANCEN eG, the Department of Architecture offers a solidarity-based financing model for tuition fees: the Reverse Generation Contract (UGV). Under this model, CHANCEN eG assumes a share of the fees during the programme. In return, you commit to an income-related payment after graduation: Once you have started working, you will repay a percentage of your income to finance subsequent study places.
